method: Calculate charge passed: Q = I * t = 1.50 A * (30.0 * 60) s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons: n(e-) = Q / F = 2700 / 96500 = 0.027979... mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, moles of Cu is half moles of electrons: n(Cu) = n(e-) / 2 = 0.013989... mol. Calculate mass: m = n * Ar = 0.013989... * 63.55 = 0.889 g.
checks: Mass is reasonable for short electrolysis at low current.
